decks.notes: The deck focuses on assembling a combo involving Prossh, Skyraider of Kher and Food Chain to generate infinite mana and creature tokens, allowing for a powerful win condition. The deck runs various tutors and card draw spells to consistently find the combo pieces and disrupt opponents' strategies. It also includes a toolbox of creatures that provide value and interaction, such as removal spells, card advantage engines, and ramp. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the strategy and ensure smooth gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to create a dominant board state quickly and overwhelm opponents with a powerful combo finish.

This control deck is centered around utilizing Geist of Saint Traft as the commander to create a strong defensive strategy. The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's plans with a variety of counterspells like Force of Will, Cryptic Command, and Mana Leak, while also controlling the board with removal spells such as Path to Exile and Swords to Plowshares. The deck is designed to outvalue the opponent with powerful creature threats like True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique, as well as equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte. The goal is to maintain control of the game until Geist of Saint Traft can close out the game with his hexproof angel token.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using Grand Arbiter Augustin IV's ability to make spells cost more for opponents. It aims to disrupt their game plan with counterspells, removal, and bounce spells while also drawing cards and generating card advantage. The deck includes various ways to control the board with sweepers like Wrath of God and Terminus, as well as targeted removal with cards like Swords to Plowshares and Detention Sphere. It also has extra turn spells like Time Warp to further solidify its control over the game. Overall, the deck focuses on slowing down opponents and out-valuing them in the long game to secure victory.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay with Anafenza, the Foremost as the commander. The key concept of the deck is to quickly establish a strong board presence with efficient creatures like Birds of Paradise, Dark Confidant, and Thrun, the Last Troll. The deck includes powerful removal and disruption spells like Swords to Plowshares, Thoughtseize, and Maelstrom Pulse to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, the deck includes powerful equipment like Sword of Feast and Famine and Umezawa's Jitte to enhance the creatures' abilities and deal additional damage. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent early in the game and maintain control of the battlefield to secure a victory.

The main focus of this Narset, Enlightened Master deck is to control the game by utilizing a variety of counterspells, removal spells, and board wipes to keep opponents' threats in check. The deck includes a wide range of versatile control cards such as Counterspell, Cryptic Command, Supreme Verdict, and Wrath of God, allowing the player to answer any type of threat that may arise. Additionally, Narset's ability to cast spells for free off the top of the library synergizes well with the deck's high instant and sorcery count, providing card advantage and additional control options. By effectively managing resources and disrupting opponents' strategies, this deck aims to establish dominance and control the pace of the game.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive creatures such as True-Name Nemesis and Vendilion Clique. By using cards like Force of Will, Counterspell, and Cryptic Command, the deck aims to deny the opponent's key spells and maintain a strong board presence with Nin, the Pain Artist as the commander. The deck also includes utility cards like Vedalken Shackles and Teferi, Mage of Zhalfir to further disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the strategy revolves around efficiently controlling the game tempo, disrupting the opponent's plans, and eventually closing out the game with powerful creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on using the commander, Child of Alara, as a board wipe to control the game while ramping and setting up the graveyard for powerful reanimation targets. The deck includes a variety of lands for color fixing and ramp, as well as powerful reanimation targets such as Ashen Rider, Elesh Norn, and Griselbrand. Support cards like Animate Dead, Entomb, and Reanimate allow for efficient graveyard interaction, while counterspells and removal spells help control the board. The deck aims to disrupt opponents with hand disruption and counter magic, while setting up explosive turns with reanimated threats and powerful spells like Terminus and Toxic Deluge.
